name: Chickpea Quinoa Chard Pizza Crust with Roasted Caulifower
description: This Chickpea Quinoa Chard Pizza Crust with Roasted Caulifower is a great filling Pizza. Vegan Gluten-free Recipe
recipeIngredient: 1 cup sprouted or cooked chickpeas (I used sprouted over 1.5 days)
1/2 cup sprouted or cooked Quinoa (I used Alter Eco rainbow Quinoa, sprouted over 1 day)
2 Tablespoons organic oil of choice (I used 1 Tbsp virgin coconut and 1 Tbp extra virgin olive oil)
1/2 teaspoon Chana masala spice blend (also called chole masala in Indian stores or Garam masala or curry powder)
1  dried red chili  (or to taste or skip)
1/2 to 2/3 cup small cauliflower florets (1 inch or smaller)
Chopped cilantro (optional, I cant imagine anything chickpea without some cilantro:))
spices and herbs of choice (I added cumin, ginger powder, chopped cilantro, lemon juice, salt, pepper)
Or use other sauces like marinara or pesto

itemListElement.text: Pulse all ingredients for the crust until a thick doughy batter is formed.
itemListElement.name: Pulse all ingredients for the crust until a thick doughy batter is formed.

itemListElement.text: Spread the thick batter on parchment lined sheet using circular motion to about a 1/4 inch thick. (To help make the crust sturdier and less wet, add some flaxmeal or other dry seed meal)
itemListElement.name: Spread the thick batter on parchment lined sheet using circular motion to about a 1/4 inch thick. (To help make the crust sturdier and less wet, add some flaxmeal or other dry seed meal)

itemListElement.text: Bake in preheated 375 degrees F  / 190ºc for 15 minutes,
itemListElement.name: Bake in preheated 375 degrees F  / 190ºc for 15 minutes,

itemListElement.text: Meanwhile, pulse 1 or more tomato, garlic, spices, herbs into a coarse mix.
itemListElement.name: Meanwhile, pulse 1 or more tomato, garlic, spices, herbs into a coarse mix.

itemListElement.text: Mix the cauliflower, salt, pepper and marinate till ready to put on the base.
itemListElement.name: Mix the cauliflower, salt, pepper and marinate till ready to put on the base.

itemListElement.text: (Or coat Cauliflower in salt, pepper and olive oil and use the sauce as base)
itemListElement.name: (Or coat Cauliflower in salt, pepper and olive oil and use the sauce as base)

itemListElement.text: Prep other veggies, chop into small pieces. I used grape tomatoes, you can add some sweet potatoes, broccoli, bell peppers, onions, anything that you want to grab :).
itemListElement.name: Prep other veggies, chop into small pieces. I used grape tomatoes, you can add some sweet potatoes, broccoli, bell peppers, onions, anything that you want to grab :).

itemListElement.text: Take the base out once the center is slightly firm. Spread sauce, top it with the marinated cauliflower, other veggies, sprinkle salt and pepper/chili flakes to taste.
itemListElement.name: Take the base out once the center is slightly firm. Spread sauce, top it with the marinated cauliflower, other veggies, sprinkle salt and pepper/chili flakes to taste.

itemListElement.text: (Use a less wet sauce, else the crust will get mushy and even more delicate)
itemListElement.name: (Use a less wet sauce, else the crust will get mushy and even more delicate)

itemListElement.text: Bake for another 35-45 minutes in the center or bottom rack.(depends on your oven and crust thickness. Lift up the crust lightly with a spatula to check that its not wet in the middle)
itemListElement.name: Bake for another 35-45 minutes in the center or bottom rack.(depends on your oven and crust thickness. Lift up the crust lightly with a spatula to check that its not wet in the middle)

itemListElement.text: Top with chopped cilantro or fresh herb of choice, Serve hot!
itemListElement.name: Top with chopped cilantro or fresh herb of choice, Serve hot!
